page.title: 10FISHING OUT OF AMBLE
page.content: There are approximately{sixty-nine {vessels operating from Amble.}These consist of{cobles, large trawlers, {seine netters and private charter {fishing boats.}Of the large commercial fishing boats,{four are trawlers and {seven are seine netters.}Occasionally a{prawn fishing boat}calls into Amble. The average sized{crew}of a large fishing vessel consists of{seven members. On a{coble}the crew is{four, while{salmon netters}have{two members. {Cobles}are about{twenty-four feet long. They fish for{salmon}usually by setting{nets that float on the water surface to{a depth of ten feet. {Commercial seine netters}use a method called{palagic fishing}for surface fish such as{herring and mackeral.}The {trawlers fish}the sea bed for{cod, {haddock and flat fish. Charter boat fishermen take{anglers}out for a fee.
